intro: Zygia scopulina, commonly known as the rock zygia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, inconspicuous yellow flowers that typically appear in clusters. The plant is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. Zygia scopulina is a perennial herb that grows close to the ground, often forming dense mats in its natural habitat. Its botanical features make it well adapted to harsh environmental conditions, including drought and poor soil nutrients.
